Teacher responsibility for safety

As a teacher, it is also your responsibility to make sure that the students are able to learn in a safe environment. This means doing your part in following our policies regarding the safety basics for teachers. Poor judgment on safety and privacy will be dealt with on a case-to-case basis and can result in{' '} teacher removal .

 

Classroom Safety Basics

  • The teacher should be present during the live meetings at all times.
    • The teacher should always have their cameras turned on during class.
  • Always check every learner’s identity before the class. This means seeing them via video or audio at least once every class. Tell all learners and parents that they should inform you if connecting through video is not possible. You should ask to confirm their identity or presence by speaking with the teacher usually before the online class start.
  • If class discussion includes potentially dangerous materials, instruct them on how to handle the materials properly.
  • When teaching about sensitive topics, always make sure that your learners are well-equipped for the discussion. Learn more about our class criteria{' '} here .
    • Always check if the learners are comfortable during the discussion when talking about sensitive topics.
  • Report any cases of students exhibiting concerning behavior (e.g. bullying, abuse, mental illness) to{' '} customercare@tagpros.us .
  • Report any cases where a learner’s safety is threatened or compromised.
    • Contact us via{' '} customercare@tagpros.us . We will be contacting various institutions to resolve the case immediately.
  • Do not encourage learners to share their personal information.
    • Ask for their parents permission if you will have them submit personal works.
  • Keep all direct communications in our Tagpros platform
    • You are allowed to message only parents directly.
    • If a learner wants to keep in touch with you after class, reach out to their parents to discuss about it
  • Do not share your personal information with learners and parents.
  • Do not share Jitsi links via direct messaging.
  • Also read about{' '} Safeguarding the Community as Parents {' '} to learn more about how you can work with the parents in creating a safer community for your classes.
); }; export default SafeguardingTeachers;
